doc.after: The population comprises approximately 73 ethnic groups most of which are Bantu speaking Almost 90 of Zambians belong to the nine main ethnolinguistic groups the Nyanja Chewa Bemba Tonga Tumbuka Lunda Luvale Kaonde Nkoya and Lozi In the rural areas each ethnic group is concentrated in a particular geographic region of the country and many groups are very small and not as well known However all the ethnic groups can be found in significant numbers in Lusaka and the Copperbelt
